name: libvirt
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing libvirt cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`libvirt` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/dmacvicar/terraform-provider-libvirt).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing libvirt cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/dmacvicar/terraform-provider-libvirt)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-libvirt` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-libvirt/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-libvirt` repo](https://github.com/dmacvicar/terraform-provider-libvirt/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/dmacvicar/terraform-provider-libvirt)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-libvirt` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-libvirt/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-libvirt` repo](https://github.com/dmacvicar/terraform-provider-libvirt/issues).

uri.description: libvirt connection URI for operations. See https://libvirt.org/uri.html

sourceHost.description: IP address to listen on. Defaults to 127.0.0.1.

sourceService.description:
Port number or a service name. Defaults to a
random port.

targetType.description:
for the first console and defaults to `serial`.
Subsequent `console` blocks must have a different type - usually `virtio`.

type.description: the type of graphics emulation (default is "spice")

blockDevice.description: The path to the host device to use as the block device for this disk.

file.description: The filename to use as the block device for this disk (read-only)

scsi.description:
Use a scsi controller for this disk.  The controller
model is set to `virtio-scsi`

url.description: The http url to use as the block device for this disk (read-only)

volumeId.description: The volume id to use for this disk.

wwn.description:
Specify a WWN to use for the disk if the disk is using
a scsi controller, if not specified then a random wwn is generated for the disk

accessmode.description:
specifies the security mode for accessing the source. By default
the `mapped` mode is chosen.

readonly.description:
enables exporting filesystem as a readonly mount for guest, by
default read-only access is given.

source.description: the directory of the host to be shared with the guest.

target.description:
an arbitrary string tag that is exported to the guest as a hint for
where to mount the source.

listenAddress.description:
IP Address where the VNC listener should be started if
`listen_type` is set to `address`. Defaults to 127.0.0.1

type.description: the type of graphics emulation (default is "spice")

websocket.description: Port to listen on for VNC WebSocket functionality (-1 meaning auto-allocation)

addresses.description: An IP address for this domain in this network.

bridge.description:
Provides a bridge from the VM directly to the LAN. This assumes
there is a bridge device on the host which has one or more of the hosts
physical NICs enslaved. The guest VM will have an associated _tun_ device
created and enslaved to the bridge. The IP range / network configuration is
whatever is used on the LAN. This provides the guest VM full incoming &
outgoing net access just like a physical machine.

hostname.description:
A hostname that will be assigned to this domain
resource in this network.

mac.description: The specific MAC address to use for this interface.

macvtap.description:
Packets whose destination is on the same host as where they
originate from are directly delivered to the target macvtap device. Both
origin and destination devices need to be in bridge mode for direct delivery.
If either one of them is in vepa mode, a VEPA capable bridge is required.

passthrough.description:
This feature attaches a virtual function of a SRIOV capable
NIC directly to a VM without losing the migration capability. All packets are
sent to the VF/IF of the configured network device. Depending on the
capabilities of the device additional prerequisites or limitations may apply;
for example, on Linux this requires kernel 2.6.38 or newer.

vepa.description:
All VMs' packets are sent to the external bridge. Packets whose
destination is a VM on the same host as where the packet originates from are
sent back to the host by the VEPA capable bridge (today's bridges are
typically not VEPA capable).

waitForLease.description:
When creating the domain resource, wait until the
network interface gets a DHCP lease from libvirt, so that the computed IP
addresses will be available when the domain is up and the plan applied.

file.description:
path to the file backing the NVRAM store for non-volatile variables. When provided,
this file must be writable and specific to this domain, as it will be updated when running the
domain. However, `libvirt` can  manage this automatically (and this is the recommended solution)
if a mapping for the firmware to a _variables file_ exists in `/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf:nvram`.
In that case, `libvirt` will copy that variables file into a file specific for this domain.

template.description:
path to the file used to override variables from the master NVRAM
store.

backendDevicePath.description: Path to TPM device on the host, ex: `/dev/tpm0`

backendPersistentState.description: Keep the TPM state when a transient domain is powered off or undefined

model.description: TPM model provided to the guest

type.description: the type of graphics emulation (default is "spice")

enabled.description: when false, disable the DHCP server
when false, disable the DHCP server

forwarders.description: Either `address`, `domain`, or both must be set

hosts.description:
a DNS host entry block. You can have one or more of these
blocks in your DNS definition. You must specify both `ip` and `hostname`.

localOnly.description: true/false: true means 'do not forward unresolved requests for this domain to the part DNS server

srvs.description:
a DNS SRV entry block. You can have one or more of these blocks
in your DNS definition. You must specify `service` and `protocol`.

domain.description: The domain used by the DNS server.
The domain used by the DNS server.

options.description:
a Dnsmasq option entry block. You can have one or more of these
blocks in your definition. You must specify both `option_name` and `option_value`.

provider.description:
The provider type for the libvirt package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

uri.description: libvirt connection URI for operations. See https://libvirt.org/uri.html
libvirt connection URI for operations. See https://libvirt.org/uri.html

name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.

pool.description:
The pool where the resource will be created.
If not given, the `default` pool will be used.
For user_data, network_config and meta_data parameters have a look at upstream doc:
http://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/nocloud.html#datasource-nocloud

name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.

pool.description:
The pool where the resource will be created.
If not given, the `default` pool will be used.
For user_data, network_config and meta_data parameters have a look at upstream doc:
http://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/nocloud.html#datasource-nocloud

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering CloudInitDisk resources.

name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.

pool.description:
The pool where the resource will be created.
If not given, the `default` pool will be used.
For user_data, network_config and meta_data parameters have a look at upstream doc:
http://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/datasources/nocloud.html#datasource-nocloud

arch.description:
The architecture for the VM (probably x86_64 or i686),
you normally won't need to set this unless you are building a special VM

autostart.description:
Set to `true` to start the domain on host boot up.
If not specified `false` is assumed.

bootDevices.description:
A list of devices (dev) which defines boot order. Example
below.

cloudinit.description:
The `libvirt.CloudInitDisk` disk that has to be used by
the domain. This is going to be attached as a CDROM ISO. Changing the
cloud-init won't cause the domain to be recreated, however the change will
have effect on the next reboot.

coreosIgnition.description:
The
[libvirt.Ignition](https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/libvirt/r/coreos_ignition.html) resource
that is to be used by the CoreOS domain.

cpu.description:
Configures CPU mode. See below for more
details.

description.description:
The description for domain.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
This data is not used by libvirt in any way, it can contain any information the user wants.

disks.description:
An array of one or more disks to attach to the domain. The
`disk` object structure is documented below.

emulator.description: The path of the emulator to use

filesystems.description:
An array of one or more host filesystems to attach to
the domain. The `filesystem` object structure is documented
below.

firmware.description:
The UEFI rom images for exercising UEFI secure boot in a qemu
environment. Users should usually specify one of the standard _Open Virtual Machine
Firmware_ (_OVMF_) images available for their distributions. The file will be opened
read-only.

fwCfgName.description: The name of the firmware config path where ignition file is stored: default is `opt/com.coreos/config`. If you are using [Flatcar Linux](https://docs.flatcar-linux.org/os/booting-with-libvirt/#creating-the-domain-xml), the value is `opt/org.flatcar-linux/config`.

initrd.description: The path of the initrd to boot.

kernel.description: The path of the kernel to boot

machine.description:
The machine type,
you normally won't need to set this unless you are running on a platform that
defaults to the wrong machine type for your template

memory.description:
The amount of memory in MiB. If not specified the domain
will be created with 512 MiB of memory be used.

name.description:
A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

networkInterfaces.description:
An array of one or more network interfaces to
attach to the domain. The `network_interface` object structure is documented
below.

nvram.description: this block allows specifying the following attributes related to the _nvram_:

qemuAgent.description: By default is disabled, set to true for enabling it. More info [qemu-agent](https://wiki.libvirt.org/page/Qemu_guest_agent).

running.description:
Use `false` to turn off the instance. If not specified,
true is assumed and the instance, if stopped, will be started at next apply.

tpm.description: TPM device to attach to the domain. The `tpm` object structure is documented below.

vcpu.description:
The amount of virtual CPUs. If not specified, a single CPU
will be created.

arch.description:
The architecture for the VM (probably x86_64 or i686),
you normally won't need to set this unless you are building a special VM

Set to `true` to start the domain on host boot up.
If not specified `false` is assumed.

below.

libvirt:index/network:Network.description:
Manages a VM network resource within libvirt. For more information see
[the official documentation](https://libvirt.org/formatnetwork.html).

addresses.description:
A list of (0 or 1) IPv4 and (0 or 1) IPv6 subnets in
CIDR notation.  This defines the subnets associated to that network.
This argument is also used to define the address on the real host.
If `dhcp {  enabled = true }` addresses is also used to define the address range served by
the DHCP server.
No DHCP server will be started if `addresses` is omitted.

autostart.description:
Set to `true` to start the network on host boot up.
If not specified `false` is assumed.

bridge.description:
The bridge device defines the name of a bridge
device which will be used to construct the virtual network (when not provided,
it will be automatically obtained by libvirt in `none`, `nat`, `route` and `open` modes).

dhcp.description:
DHCP configuration. 
You need to use it in conjuction with the adresses variable.

dns.description: configuration of DNS specific settings for the network

dnsmasqOptions.description:
configuration of Dnsmasq options for the network
You need to provide a list of option name and value pairs.

domain.description: The domain used by the DNS server.

mtu.description:
The MTU to set for the underlying network interfaces. When
not supplied, libvirt will use the default for the interface, usually 1500.
Libvirt version 5.1 and greater will advertise this value to nodes via DHCP.

name.description:
A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

routes.description:
a list of static routes. A `cidr` and a `gateway` must
be provided. The `gateway` must be reachable via the bridge interface.

addresses.description:
A list of (0 or 1) IPv4 and (0 or 1) IPv6 subnets in
CIDR notation.  This defines the subnets associated to that network.
This argument is also used to define the address on the real host.
If `dhcp {  enabled = true }` addresses is also used to define the address range served by
the DHCP server.
No DHCP server will be started if `addresses` is omitted.

autostart.description:
Set to `true` to start the network on host boot up.
If not specified `false` is assumed.

bridge.description:
The bridge device defines the name of a bridge
device which will be used to construct the virtual network (when not provided,
it will be automatically obtained by libvirt in `none`, `nat`, `route` and `open` modes).

dhcp.description:
DHCP configuration. 
You need to use it in conjuction with the adresses variable.

dns.description: configuration of DNS specific settings for the network

dnsmasqOptions.description:
configuration of Dnsmasq options for the network
You need to provide a list of option name and value pairs.

domain.description: The domain used by the DNS server.

mtu.description:
The MTU to set for the underlying network interfaces. When
not supplied, libvirt will use the default for the interface, usually 1500.
Libvirt version 5.1 and greater will advertise this value to nodes via DHCP.

name.description:
A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

routes.description:
a list of static routes. A `cidr` and a `gateway` must
be provided. The `gateway` must be reachable via the bridge interface.

name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.

path.description:
The directory where the pool will keep all its volumes. This is only relevant to (and required by)
the "dir" type pools.

type.description: The type of the pool. Currently, only "dir" supported.

name.description: A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.

path.description:
The directory where the pool will keep all its volumes. This is only relevant to (and required by)
the "dir" type pools.

type.description: The type of the pool. Currently, only "dir" supported.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Pool resources.

path.description:
The directory where the pool will keep all its volumes. This is only relevant to (and required by)
the "dir" type pools.

type.description: The type of the pool. Currently, only "dir" supported.

baseVolumeId.description: The backing volume (CoW) to use for this volume.

baseVolumeName.description:
The name of the backing volume (CoW) to use
for this volume. Note well: when `base_volume_pool` is not specified the
volume is going to be searched inside of `pool`.

baseVolumePool.description:
The name of the storage pool containing the
volume defined by `base_volume_name`.

name.description:
A unique name for the resource, required by libvirt.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

pool.description:
The storage pool where the resource will be created.
If not given, the `default` storage pool will be used.

baseVolumeId.description: The backing volume (CoW) to use for this volume.

baseVolumeName.description:

for this volume. Note well: when `base_volume_pool` is not specified the
volume is going to be searched inside of `pool`.

baseVolumePool.description:
The name of the storage pool containing the
volume defined by `base_volume_name`.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getNetworkDnsHostTemplate.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getNetworkDnsHostTemplate.
